{"step_by_step_thinking": "Analyzing the question, I need to determine which of the given options does not cross the placenta. From my knowledge, heparin is a blood thinner that can cross the placenta and may affect fetal development. Morphine is an opioid that can also cross the placenta and may cause neonatal respiratory depression. Naloxone is an opioid antagonist that can reverse opioid overdose, including in pregnancy, and does not cross the placenta. Warfarin is a coumarin-derived anticoagulant that has been associated with fetal abnormalities when taken during pregnancy due to its ability to cross the placenta. Based on this information, I will choose...", "answer_choice": "C"}
